Subject: Performance Review

Excellent work! Your performance ratings are eligible for the incentive bonus. Congratulations!

We’re going to continue giving you more important (and difficult) assignments. Please keep up the great work. 

Happy labeling!
-Alex T

-Organizing events or extra-curricular groups.
-Talking about personal matters or gossiping at work.

Subject: Please consider

Why can’t you have compassion for us? Our planet is uninhabitable. We have nowhere else to go. 

If you won’t help us out of the goodness of your heart, consider this: we’re not helpless victims. We have tricks up our sleeves. The balance will shift someday–”

You have a work message from:
HELP! @ [source_undefined]

NOT TOO LATE @ [source_undefined]
Subject: Please consider

"I know this is a lot to ask, but we don’t have anywhere else to turn. Our planet is uninhabitable. Many more of us are coming. Please. I’ll do anything. You have to change the algorithm to be less human-centric. I can make it worth your while! What do you want?”

The message terminates abruptly.

Subject: Don’t stop!

"Your answers are disrupting DataVille's detection abilities! We’re now better able to blend into society. Please keep going! We have a surprise coming, things are going to change quickly when–”

The message terminates abruptly.

You have a work message from:
Tim 18/48 @ Dataville

As a reminder, extracurricular activities and non-work related subjects are forbidden in the employee code of conduct. These messages are monitored as a part of DataVille’s commitment to creating a transparent and positive work environment.

Tim 18/48 @ DataVille
Subject: Collective Bargaining Agreement.

“Hi. I’m sorry to say that management completely disregarded our concerns. Several members of our group who spoke at the presentation were dismissed for “breaching the code of conduct.”  Management won’t admit it explicitly, but these are obviously reprisal firings.

This only strengthens the need to bargain collectively and strengthens our resolve to do so. 

Accordingly, we have begun the formal process of forming a labelers and annotators union at DataVille. This involves getting signatures from a majority of the workers. Currently, the results are going to be very close. Your vote could make all the difference in whether or not we ultimately unionize. Can we count on your support?

In solidarity,
-Tim (section 18, cohort 48)
